item.description:
Come enjoy a FREE all-Mozart concert at MIT.

Hosted by John Harbison, Institute Professor at MIT, the event will feature a brief discussion about Robert Levin’s completions of Mozart fragments and performances of the Divertimento in Bb major for Horns and Strings, K. 287; the Trio for Violin, Cello and Piano, K. 442; and the Concerto in D Major, K. 537.The concert includes includes the Boston premiere of Robert Levin’s completion of three unfinished Mozart trio movements.

For more concert details see http://mta.scripts.mit.edu/CES/2012/01/19/john-harbison-hosts-mozart-marathon-at-mit/

Meeting location: IMPORTANT. So that we can find one another more easily we will be assembling in front of the Dunkin Donuts inside the MIT student center (at the Mass. Ave entrance) at 7:00 and will head over to Kresge promptly at 7:15. Please be on time. The concert starts at 8:00.

MIT is easily accessible by public transportation. Additionally, $5 parking is available at the MIT West Garage, 125 Vassar St., Cambridge.\

Hope to see you there!
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the MIT Student Center 84 Mass. Ave entrance, ground floor by Dunkin Donuts. I will have a Meetup sign.
item.name: Mozart Marathon at MIT
